channel.title: If this community
channel.description: Worked on a single server together, wouldn't it be much easier to achieve something greater than any other server out there? I mean.. obviously there's a load of skilled people on the forum, but it seems everyone tries to solo some 'remake' or has only 2-3 other members working on it.. It seems redundant to be honest... I mean if everyone contributed worthy things to one community-made server then... well... I believe it would work amazingly...and great things would be achieved for the RSPS community...But yeah.. I guess It won't ever happen... but just the thought is pretty awesome..:)

item.title: If this community
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:67, topic:439777”][quote author=Spades link=topic=542469.msg3976650#msg3976650 date=1334717566]
He made his server easier to add things then a server like WinterLove. So you don’t need to edit the original class files, he has plugins that have everything. Most everything is stored in the database and just has item id’s object id’s, and npc id’s. So its made really simple to add/edit things. We have ~5 people working on the server right now, so we’re getting a lot done a lot faster then most servers.
[/quote]
Its true! I just have to program a plugin that uses the data, and lots of other people can work together on gathering that data so that the server can make use of it. And the plugin system is amazing for enabling and disabling specific features of the server, so for example if a major bug is found in lets say, Woodcutting, we just disable it temporarily while we fix the bug. [/quote]
that actually sounds pretty awesome:)

Read full topic

item.title: If this community
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Spades:

He made his server easier to add things then a server like WinterLove. So you don’t need to edit the original class files, he has plugins that have everything. Most everything is stored in the database and just has item id’s object id’s, and npc id’s. So its made really simple to add/edit things. We have ~5 people working on the server right now, so we’re getting a lot done a lot faster then most servers.

Its true! I just have to program a plugin that uses the data, and lots of other people can work together on gathering that data so that the server can make use of it. And the plugin system is amazing for enabling and disabling specific features of the server, so for example if a major bug is found in lets say, Woodcutting, we just disable it temporarily while we fix the bug.

Taharok:

Welcome back, ry.

Thank you!

Read full topic

He made his server easier to add things then a server like WinterLove. So you don’t need to edit the original class files, he has plugins that have everything. Most everything is stored in the database and just has item id’s object id’s, and npc id’s. So its made really simple to add/edit things. We have ~5 people working on the server right now, so we’re getting a lot done a lot faster then most servers.

item.title: If this community
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:60, topic:439777”][quote author=ry60003333 link=topic=542469.msg3976613#msg3976613 date=1334715828]

I put my server on hold, and a small group of us have been working on a server for awhile now. Hoping to push out a topic later. Prepare to be amazed. It’s another remake being done correctly Not being done on a Winterlove/Hyperion/Rs2hd/whatever else there is.

You all realize that Ry60003333 has a multi-version server and he could easily set one of these things up.

We are currently working on a RS remake on the base base out there, and the base does support multi version and we have a server running live using it at this very moment. You guys should really learn to pay more attention to when people actually post something relevant to the topic at hand, you seem more interesting in arguing about the community!
[/quote]
How are we supposed to know o.o…

How can we help?[/quote]

Contact me We’re going to be Open Beta hopefully Saturday if all goes well.

Read full topic

item.title: If this community
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:53, topic:439777”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=542469.msg3975905#msg3975905 date=1334640674]

Even posting in this topic makes me feel stupid/ashamed because of the absurd stupidity contributed by each and every one of you.

I see nothings changed, you guys really don’t actually understand how fucking difficult it is too keep you idiots in line.

Yeah, well, it’s a volunteer position. They can opt out any time they want. The reason they don’t opt out, but instead keep complaining about it is their massive e-peen. It’s pretty fucking obvious that moparscape is filled with shitheads, so people becoming moderators should be ready to deal with shitheads. Common sense?

Hes right you know, it took 26 infractions and 3 temp bans for me!

I’ve been wondering about you. Are you a terrible troll or just flat out retarded? This is an honest question, I’m still confused as to why you’re still here.

That’s 100% true… everybody thinks it’s easy… then they complain about staff abusing

please host ass kissing seminar

rep++ rep++ rep++

Tbh I’ve been waiting for someone to ask that loaep

Why am I still here? Not sure, surprised mods haven’t perma banned my sorry ass yet, but when instead of just going all out and flaming the fuck out of someone when I get pissed off, I just turn it into a troll, much simpler tbh but I don’t try not to do that anymore
[/quote]
You’re not even a good troll. From what I’ve gathered you’re just someone who looks like an idiot and attempts to play it off as trolling.

Yeah, well, it’s a volunteer position. They can opt out any time they want. The reason they don’t opt out, but instead keep complaining about it is their massive e-peen. It’s pretty fucking obvious that moparscape is filled with shitheads, so people becoming moderators should be ready to deal with shitheads. Common sense?

Sure, but don’t fucking blame the staff for it. I’m usually someone who flames staff members… but I can honestly say, moderating MSCP wasn’t as easy as it sounds. I didn’t even have the patience Davidi2 shows in this topic, I’d of just moderated all of you. idgaf[/quote]
that too loaep

Read full topic
